summary: This document outlines the amendments to The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust One, including the appointment of new co-Trustees and provisions regarding the management and distribution of trust assets. It details the roles of various individuals involved in the trust and the conditions under which the trust operates.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: He is the Grantor of The Jeffrey E. Epstein 2001 Trust One and has the authority to amend the trust.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: She is designated as a successor co-Trustee of the trust and has specific responsibilities regarding the distribution of trust assets.

persons.name: Ira Zicherman
persons.context: He is appointed as a successor co-Trustee of the trust.

persons.name: Jeffrey A. Schantz
persons.context: He was initially a co-Trustee of the trust and is mentioned in the context of his removal and designation of successors.

persons.name: Mark Lawrence Epstein
persons.context: He is mentioned as a beneficiary of the trust, entitled to a distribution upon the Grantor's death.

persons.name: Robert Goodman
persons.context: He is mentioned as a beneficiary related to debts forgiven by the Grantor.

persons.name: Robert Gold
persons.context: He is mentioned as a beneficiary related to debts forgiven by the Grantor.

persons.name: Eva Andersson Dubin
persons.context: She is mentioned as a beneficiary who may receive distributions from the trust.

persons.name: Darken Indyke
persons.context: He is designated as a Trustee in the event that Jeffrey A. Schantz resigns.

persons.name: Joseph Pagano
persons.context: He is mentioned as a member, director, and trustee of a potential charitable organization established by the Trustees.

persons.name: Paul Hoffman
persons.context: He notarized the document, confirming the identities of the individuals involved.

persons.name: Harry I. Beller
persons.context: He notarized the document, confirming the identities of the individuals involved.

persons.name: Anna N. Vero
persons.context: She notarized the document, confirming the identities of the individuals involved.

connections.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is appointed as a co-Trustee by Jeffrey E. Epstein.
Ira Zicherman is appointed as a co-Trustee by Jeffrey E. Epstein.
Jeffrey A. Schantz was a co-Trustee appointed by Jeffrey E. Epstein.
Mark Lawrence Epstein is the brother of Jeffrey E. Epstein and a beneficiary of the trust.
Eva Andersson Dubin is a beneficiary who may receive distributions from the trust established by Jeffrey E. Epstein.
Ghislaine Maxwell has responsibilities regarding the distribution of trust assets to Eva Andersson Dubin.

keyFacts: The trust document outlines the removal of Jeffrey A. Schantz as a co-Trustee and the appointment of Ghislaine Maxwell and Ira Zicherman as successor co-Trustees.
The trust includes provisions for the distribution of assets to various beneficiaries, including Mark Lawrence Epstein and Eva Andersson Dubin.
Debts owed to Jeffrey E. Epstein by family members and friends are forgiven as part of the trust provisions.
The trust allows for the establishment of separate trusts and includes discretionary powers for the Trustees.
The document was notarized by multiple notaries, confirming the identities of the individuals involved.
